result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter J Danner

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:29 AM; Case called for Sentencing hearing.  Defendant Peter J Danner in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Peter J Danner.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Barnes presents statements; she is requesting a new sentencing date to allow time for her client to complete some treatment.  Atty. Barnes is requesting a new sentencing date in late December.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for a new sentencing date.  Court inquires as to why the defendant missed court back on 10/24/22.  Defendant advises he just forgot about the hearing date.  Court reminds the defendant he must appear for all court appearances or risk having a capias issued.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:56 PM; Case called for Sentencing hearing. Defendant Peter J Danner not in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Peter J Danner.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Barnes advises that she did call her client before the hearing but did not get an answer.  Atty. Barnes notes that her client has not missed a previous hearing date and believes her client just possibly forgot about today's hearing.  Court will authorize but stay the issuance of a capias and adjourn for a new sentencing hearing later this week.  Atty. Barnes inquires if she can get a date next week.  Court will adjourn for sentencing next week.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:02 AM; Case called for Plea hearing. Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Peter J Danner in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Peter J Danner.  Court notes the matter was set for a jury trial today, but that was canceled pursuant to a letter filed by counsel advising parties have resolved the matter.  Court confirms with counsel this will be a plea only today and the matter will be set over for sentencing to allow time for defendant to complete treatment.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Barnes confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty. Court will adjourn for sentencing in about 60 days.  Court also confirms with counsel they are ok with having sentencing set back before Branch 7.  Court will also order that bail remain as previously set.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by Atty.Barnes.
Filed by Atty. Barnes advising the parties have resolved the matter and is requesting to proceed with a plea only tomorrow in place of the jury trial.
Plea hearing on August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions filed by Atty. Barnes.
Signed by Michael Neimon on 8/19/22.

9:44 AM; Case called for Jury status hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Peter J Danner in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Peter J Danner. Court notes the matter is set for jury trial on 08/23/2022.  Atty. Barnes advises that defense is prepared to proceed to trial next week. State advises they are also prepared to proceed to trial.  Court advises counsel that Judge Aprahamian will be hearing the trial.  No objections from Defense or the State.  Court also notes it is missing defense's proposed jury instructions; they must be filed by noon on 08/19/2022.
Defendant's Motion in Limine filed by Atty. Barnes.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions.
State's Motion in Limine.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Jury status hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:53 AM Defendant Peter J Danner in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. Barnes is asking the matter be set for a jury trial, and believes it will be a 1 day trial.  Court adjourns for jury status and jury trial.  Court advises counsel that the proposed jury instructions, motions in limine, and witness lists are due no later than 48 hours before the Jury status hearing.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Priya Barnes
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:23 AM Defendant Peter J Danner in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
